attributes.action: TV licence removal if you can prove you have no terrestrial aerial or SKY TV to view any BBC channels
attributes.additional_details:
The Government should remove the TV Licence Fee for users that DO NOT have any way of viewing BBC/Terrestrial channels.

Users who only have SKY TV cannot view any BBC or Terrestrial TV if they have no TV Aerial for viewing, they can only view it using their SKY box which they already pay a subscription for.

Why does our Government allow users to pay twice, once to the BBC and again to SKY?   If you DO NOT have an aerial you CANNOT view any BBC channels. Therefore, the removal of TV Licence costs are a fair way for users that pay a SKY subscription.
